ovdesc.p: This application allows Funds Transfer to be customised to the requirements of particular local clearing systems.
Details specified will be used only by the BC transaction type within FUNDS.TRANSFER, and by the delivery system for diversion of other payment messages into the clearing system.

Field specifications can be redefined for the FUNDS TRANSFER application. Maximum and minimum field lengths, maximum number of lines for multivalued fields, and validation of input against another file can be specified. This ensures that the data entered conforms with the local clearing system specifications.
Special routines for cross validation, delivery output and accounting within Funds Transfer can be defined here.
Any interface with the clearing system from the T24 delivery system should also be defined here. Payment message types which are to be diverted into the local clearing system can be specified.
Once defined for a particular clearing system, the record should not require any site specific changes.

desc.p: Specifies the special routine to be used in the Funds Transfer application when cross validating BC transactions.
When a new local clearing system needs to be set up, a special cross-validation routine will need to be written.

The purpose of this field is to minimise the number of local program changes required in the funds transfer core module when a new clearing system is required. Only new routines specific to the system will need to be written.
1-40 Alphanumeric program name. (Optional input)
Input must exist on PGM.FILE as a type S (subroutine) program.
Specifies in which currencies payments may be sent and received from the clearing institution.

If there is no value specified in this field, payment can only be sent in the local currency of the company. If payment can be made in a currency which is different to the local currency it should be specified here, if payment can be sent in more than 1 currency, also possible currencies (including the local) should be specified in this field.
Optional input. Must be a valid CURRENCY. No Duplicates allowed.

Input of Y in this field denotes that the enrichment defined in CHECKFIELD is a multi language field, and the enrichment will be displayed in the language of the user.

Specifies which payments are to be diverted into the clearing system using the DIVERSION.RTN specified.

Any payment type defined in this field will be checked in the delivery system to see if the payment is to be diverted into the local clearing system. The decision to divert the message and the subsequent delivery processing is contained in the DIVERSION.RTN.

This field defines what type of characters the sort codes on the BC.SORT.CODE file may be.
This field is used to control the type of characters allowed to enter sort codes on the BC.SORT.CODE file.

There are three possible inputs to this field: (i) A - this means that the sort code may consist of any alphanumeric type characters. (ii) S - this means that the sort code may consist of any SWIFT type characters. (iii) '' - this means that the sort code may consist of only numeric characters.

This field defines whether incoming FT transactions from the local clearing system should have the SORT.CODE of the sender bank validated against the BC.SORT.CODE file.

If the input to this field is 'YES' then the sort code from the incoming transaction will be checked against the BC.SORT.CODE file. If the sort code is not present then the FT transaction will be placed on 'HLD' and an error message produced which will be placed on the EXCEPTION.LOG.FILE.
Y(ES) The sort code will be checked. N(O) The sort code will not be checked. (Mandatory input).
This field is reserved for future expansion.

The value entered in this field should correspond to the maximum number of lines for the corresponding field in the local clearing message.
The FT.FIELD.NO can be made a NOINPUT field by entering NONE in this field.
Numeric in the range 1-9 or NONE. Multivalue field. (Mandatory input when FT.FIELD.NO is input.)
If the FT.FIELD.NO is a single valued field in Funds Transfer either 1 or NONE can be entered.

Specifies which LOCAL.REFERENCE items will be required for the local clearing system.

This field specifies which local reference items will be required for each clearing system. The values which are allowed are hardcoded for each clearing system. At present the values allowed for each clearing system are:
SIC - PAYMENT.CODE, MEM.ACCOUNT
SCC - SCC.TXN.CODE, SCC.CONSTANT, SCC.VARIABLE.1, SCC.VARIABLE.2, SCC.SPECIFIC.1, SCC.SPECIFIC.2
BGC - AC.BGC.BRANCH
Input to this field can only be one or more of the values above for the particular clearing system.

This field defines the maximum and minimum length allowed for the sort code on the BC.SORT.CODE file.
This field denotes the maximum and minimum length allowed for sort codes on the BC.SORT.CODE file. If input then the maximum length must be defined with the minimum length being optional.
Some examples of valid input are:
a) 10 - this means that the sort code may be up to 10 characters in length with no minimum defined.
b) 05 - this means that the sort code may be up to 5 characters in length with 0 being a valid input.

c) 006.1 - this means that the sort code may be up to 6 characters in length with any number of leading zeroes allowed. The minimum length is defined as 1 therefore at least one character must be entered.

Input is in two parts, the second of which is optional: (i) Maximum length - this may be preceeded by either one or two zeroes. One zero denotes that zero is a valid input, two zeroes denotes that any number of leading zeroes are allowed. (ii) Minimum length - this is optional but if input must be delimited by a '.'. (Optional input).
